Sorry - the extraneous 'org.archive.jmx.Client' was a cut/paste 
error from=
 an experiment I ran where I exploded the jar file.

The correct command I'=
m running is:

java -jar cmdline-jmxclient.jar admin:password localhost:887=
1 global-
scope:name=3DTestBean testArgs=3Dfoo

I still get the ParseExcept=
ion.

I'm very puzzled. I'm using JDK 1.5.1 - is it a JDK issue?

Thanks,

=
Mike

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Michael Stack <stack@...> 
wr=
ote:
>
> The format is argValues separated by commas (Not argType then 
> a=
rgValue).  You seem to have an 
extraneous 'org.archive.jmx.Client' in 
> y=
our TestBean sample below.  Try leaving this out.  Below is 
transcript

tempting to follow the example in the Client source:

ogging level to FINE on a password protected

r cmdline-jmxclient-X.X.jar

testNoArgs
